alert.note: Alert for Santa Cruz (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 06 at 2:23PM MST until October 06 at 3:30PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southeast Arizona, including the following county, Santa Cruz. * WHEN...Until 415 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 223 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 0.7 and 1.3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kino Springs and Lochiel. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
